inlineContent.text: One way you may try to figure out what is good is to look around at things you like — things you think are good. Maybe you can use those things to set your bar for quality. But imitation isn’t enough — a copy of something good isn’t necessarily good. Rather than simply copying you have to know what things about that good thing make it good. What do you like about it? What if you changed this one part, would you still like it then?

abstract.text: David Brunow, known as Brunow [ˈbɹunoʊ] to the folks he works with, is a human living on Earth. You might have something in common with him — if you think it is ridiculous that he is talking about himself in the first person here, so does he.
